Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.file

Static file serving for the HTTP server.

This package provides an HTTP server for serving static files from a filesystem directory, similar to traditional web servers like Apache or Nginx.

Key Components

  • FileHTTPServer - HTTP server configured to serve files from a document root
  • FileHTTPConnection - Handles individual file serving connections
  • FileHandler - Request handler implementing file serving logic
  • FileHandlerFactory - Factory for creating file handler instances

Features

  • Automatic MIME type detection
  • Directory index files (index.html, index.htm)
  • Conditional requests (If-Modified-Since, ETag)
  • Range requests for partial content
  • Directory listing (configurable)
  • Virtual host support
  • Custom error pages

Configuration Example


 <file-http-server id="web" port="80">
   <property name="document-root">/var/www/html</property>
   <property name="directory-listing">false</property>
   <property name="welcome-files">index.html,index.htm</property>
 </file-http-server>

Security

The file server includes protection against path traversal attacks and ensures that only files within the document root are accessible.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
FileHTTPServer, HTTPServer
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    FileHTTPConnection
    HTTP connection that serves files from a filesystem root.
    FileHTTPServer
    HTTP connector for serving files from a filesystem root.
